SEARCH
Package de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller

Klasse BankAccountController

java.lang.Object
de.fherfurt.clevercash.api.controller.BankAccountController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts") public class BankAccountController extends Object
Controller class for managing operations related to bank accounts associated with users. Provides endpoints for retrieving, adding, updating, and deleting bank accounts. Handles HTTP requests and interacts with the BankAccountService to perform operations on bank accounts. Ensures that access control is enforced using AuthenticationService.

Endpoints available in this controller:

  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts - Retrieve all bank accounts associated with the specified user.
  • GET /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID} - Retrieve a specific bank account by its ID.
  • POST /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts - Add a new bank account to a specific user.
  • PUT /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID} - Update an existing bank account associated with a user.
  • DELETE /api/users/{userID}/bankAccounts/{bankAccountID} - Remove a bank account from a specific user.

Handles exceptions and returns appropriate HTTP status codes and error messages for various error conditions:

  • 400 Bad Request - When request parameters or body are invalid.
  • 403 Forbidden - When the user does not have the required permissions.
  • 404 Not Found - When the requested resource (user or bank account) is not found.
  • 409 Conflict - When there is a conflict, such as an existing bank account with the same details.
Autor:
Richard Prax, Jakob Roch

  • Methodendetails

    • findBankAccounts

      @GetMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<List<?>> findBankAccounts(@PathVariable int userID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves all bank accounts associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing a list of bank accounts associated with the user if found, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the user does not exist or has no bank accounts

    • findBankAccountByID

      @GetMapping("/{bankAccountID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> findBankAccountByID(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Retrieves a single bank account associated with the specified user by its ID.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the bank account if found, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the user or bank account does not exist

    • addBankAccountToUser

      @PostMapping public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> addBankAccountToUser(@PathVariable int userID, @RequestBody NewBankAccountDTO newBankAccountDTO, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Adds a bank account to a specific user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user to whom the bank account will be added
      newBankAccountDTO - the bank account to be added
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated user object with the added bank account if successful, or ResponseEntity with status code 400 (Bad Request) if the addition fails, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the specified user does not exist

    • updateBankAccount

      @PutMapping("/{bankAccountID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> updateBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, @RequestBody NewBankAccountDTO newBankAccountDTO, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Updates a specific bank account associated with the specified user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account to be updated
      newBankAccountDTO - the updated bank account information
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity containing the updated bank account if successful, or ResponseEntity with status code 400 (Bad Request) if the update fails, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the specified user or bank account does not exist

    • deleteUserBankAccount

      @DeleteMapping("/{bankAccountID}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<?> deleteUserBankAccount(@PathVariable int userID, @PathVariable int bankAccountID, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Removes a bank account from a specific user.
      Parameter:
      userID - the unique identifier of the user from whom the bank account will be removed
      bankAccountID - the unique identifier of the bank account to be removed
      Gibt zurück:
      a ResponseEntity with status code 204 (No Content) if successful, or ResponseEntity with status code 404 (Not Found) if the specified user or bank account does not exist
